response_parsed.title: Optimizing CLI Tools Using FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide demonstrates how to create and optimize command-line interface (CLI) tools using FastAPI, a modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs, in Python 3.12+.
key_points: Utilizing FastAPI's ability to handle HTTP requests efficiently
Creating FastAPI applications as standalone CLI tools
Best practices for optimizing FastAPI-based CLI tools
Leveraging Python 3.12+ features such as improved type hints and async/await for better performance

code_examples.code:
```
from fastapi import FastAPI, CommandLineInterface
app = FastAPI()
cli = CommandLineInterface(app)
cli.add_command(main)
cli.run()
``

version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required for utilizing new features such as the async/await syntax.
FastAPI version 0.70.0 and above supports creating standalone CLI tools.
caveats: While FastAPI is designed to handle multiple concurrent requests efficiently, it may not provide the same level of performance optimization for standalone CLI tools.
Ensure that you test your application thoroughly and optimize where necessary to achieve optimal results.
